Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, is it true? Is there really an investigator coming aboard?
Where did you hear that?
It's all over the ship. It's all anyone can talk about. Despite me trying to change the subject to our glorious emperor, I might add.
Speaking of, have you heard any news about him?
Oh, well, actually, now that you mention it - Wait a minute, you're not going to get me that easily! Is there an investigator on their way or not?
It seems that way. I only heard recently myself.
This is fantastic news!

Fields.MenuText: I have to disagree. I'm not a fan of the whole idea.
I agree. It's about time we get some answers.
Fantastic news? I'll wait until I meet them before I make that declaration.

Fields.DialogueText: Why not? Don't you want answers? I don't like not knowing what's going on aboard my own ship.
Exactly. This is a mystery, and we need to solve it.
No matter who the investigator is, it's still fantastic news for us.
This means that the Empire is as concerned with solving this mystery as we are. This is great news!
*ALARM*
It seems great news is consistently followed by bad news.
Let's just blow up this bad news in service of the Emperor!
@BATTLE
Do we know when we're to expect this investigator, Captain?
Could be any day now. I was only told to expect them.
Well, the sooner the better.
Sooner the better for what?
Oh, hello, Kohei. I was just talking to the captain about the-
Myōkō.
What is it, Kanchou?
I don't think our captain wants you to share too much information with me about the investigator.
Kanchou, you aren't still holding onto these suspicions, are you? We're all the crew of the Myōkō. We all serve the Empire. We can't let this tear us apart.

Fields.MenuText: You might be right, Myōkō.
I'm just not sure who I can trust, Myōkō.
Do you really trust him, Myōkō?

Fields.DialogueText: When it comes to matters that concern Japan, I'm usually right.
You can trust me, right? Just focus on that and listen to me.
I trust everyone on board. It's the only way we can defeat the Funayūrei threat.
Well said, Myōkō. Don't worry, Kanchou. I'm no killer. And I'm glad to hear there's an investigator on their way to prove as such.
I just hope that what has happened to every other newcomer doesn't happen to them as well.
What do you mean?
I mean we don't exactly have the best track record.
*ALARM*
Well, this was a pleasant conversation. But duty calls.
Hai, duty calls. See you both on deck.
Do you really trust everyone on board? But what you said before...
When you don't trust somebody, it's important to make them feel as if you do.
You're smarter than you look, you know that?
Arigatō?
@BATTLE
Honestly, Kanchou, I still don't know who to trust on board the ship.
I know what you mean. If Officer Shino didn't really write that note... anyone could've.
Exactly. I can count the people I still trust on the ship with two fingers.
I hope I'm one of those fingers.
Of course, Kanchou. There's you and-
Myōkō, I hope you're having a pleasant day.
Takura! I was just thinking about you!
Oh, thank you for the hug, but be careful. You don't want to smash the poppo-yaki.
More poppo-yaki? You're too good to me, Takura.
It's the least I can do, really. I hope I wasn't interrupting anything, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: No, we were just making idle chatter.
We were actually having a very important private conversation.
I was just asking who Myōkō trusted the most on board.

Fields.DialogueText: It's okay, Kanchou. You can tell Takura. Besides you, she's the one I trust most on the ship.
That Takura is more than welcome to be part of. I trust her, Kanchou.
And I was about to say you, Takura.
That is far too kind, Myōkō. I don't feel like I've earned that kind of trust, really.
Oh, don't be silly. If I didn't have my hands full of poppo-yaki, I'd give you another hug to make you believe it.
*ALARM*
You might want to eat those quickly. Looks like we've got trouble.
Ohhh, but I like to savor them.
I can hold them for you if you'd like, Myōkō.
Have you ever known me to let go of poppo-yaki without a fight?
@BATTLE
Myōkō, I'd like it if you could stay close to me from now on.
Close to you, Captain? Why?

Fields.MenuText: I can't just enjoy your company? I rather do.
It's dangerous on the ship right now. And I have a feeling it'll only get more dangerous.
I don't want to force you if you find me displeasing...

Fields.DialogueText: You can... but I have a feeling there's more at play here.
More dangerous? I hope you're not expecting more death, Captain.
No! That's not it at all! I just feel like there's something you're not telling me.
The investigator should be here soon. I'm just worried that things will escalate with him on board.
You're worried about me? I can handle myself, Kanchou.
I know you can, but even so, I'd like to keep you out of as much danger as possible.
I suppose I can do that. It'll give me the opportunity to do the same for you.
Am I supposed to know what you mean by that? Because I don't.
I mean that you can look out for me, as long as I can look out for you. Neither of us will be getting in any danger any time soon.
Sounds good to me.
*ALARM*
If extremely unlikely.
Pshhh, Morganas don't count. Just watch. They don't stand a chance against our might!
@BATTLE
You're the investigator?
I prefer inspector. Inspector Ward. You can call me Ward if you'd like.
You're British.
With a detective like you aboard, why do they need me? What gave it away, the accent?
There's no need to be rude.
I'm just having a spot of fun. I meant no harm. It's just been a long trip.

Fields.MenuText: Why exactly did they send you?
Not a sea person, are you?
Just watch what you say in the future and we won't have any problems.

Fields.DialogueText: Because I'm the best at what I do. As you'll soon see for yourself.
It's more the heat. I'm more used to drear and damp. I didn't exactly dress for the weather.
Sir. I'm just here to do my job, nothing more.
I'm having a little trouble believing that the Empire would send a Brit to investigate our... troubles.
Then you're smarter than you look.
Why do I keep hearing that lately?
I don't work for the Japs, I work for the INPF. Hate to break it to you, but they're more interested in sorting all this out than your beloved Emperor.
Well, that's just not true. What would you even know of it?
I just know what I'm told. And what I inspect. So, if you'd escort me to-
*ALARM*
I hate when that happens.
Excuse us. We've-
I know the drill.
@BATTLE
Hmmm... So this is where you say he went over?
Hai. He was pretty descriptive in his suicide note.
About the railing he was going to jump over? Peculiar.
Well, it said he wanted to end his life... where he first saw me...
Oh? A lover's quarrel, perhaps?
It was nothing like that! What are you writing?!
I like to keep notes. Helps my process. So, this Shiro was infatuated with you?
Shino. And he seemed to certainly... appreciate her.
Hmmm... It's not unheard of with Belles. Many men seem to develop feelings for them. Some women as well.
Really? It's a common occurrence?
As common as any other romance aboard a naval vessel.

Fields.MenuText: I understand. Belles do seem incredibly enchanting.
I don't see the appeal. Never been attracted to ships, personally.
So they're no different from any other woman, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm? Perhaps this Shiko wasn't the only admirer.
Same here, Captain. I prefer my women flesh and blood.
Heh, I guess. Though if you do them wrong, they can blow you to pieces with all their artillery.
All the same, I'd say if Shiko took his own life, you're somewhat responsible, Kyoko.
His name is Shino. And mine is Myōkō.
I'm no good with names. But all the same, you don't feel a little responsible?
Īe. All the... feelings he wrote about in his note... he never spoke of them with me. I had no idea.
Hmmm... Interesting.
*ALARM*
You know what that means.
I do. I'll make myself scarce. Knock ‘em dead.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, do you think the inspector is right?
Right about what? About you being to blame for Shino's death?
Hai... When I first learned about his... feelings for me. I didn't think... Do you think there was something I could've done to keep all this from happening?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe. But there's probably something I could've done too.
No. I think this was probably going to happen one way or another.
He was obsessed with you. If you had done anything different, I'd be worried that he would've tried to take you with him.

Fields.DialogueText: I just wish I knew. I wish this had never happened.
Really? You think it was unavoidable?
It'd take more than jumping overboard to hurt me.
Myōkō, you have to stop thinking about all this like that. You didn't push him overboard, or tell him to jump. You had no part in it.
You're not wrong... but what if I-
No. I want you to stop dwelling. That's an order.
... You're right. There's nothing I can do about the past, but I'm sure I can do something in the here and now.
I'm going to go find Inspector Ward and see if he needs any help.
*ALARM*
Morganas. Let's deal with this first and then we can find him together.
Another excellent idea, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
He should be somewhere around here. The officers said they saw him coming back to the railings Shino jumped over.
Perhaps he found a clue that lead him somewhere else?

Fields.MenuText: Let's hope so. Clues are what we need right now.
If that's the case, he could have ended up anywhere on the ship.
Well, maybe we should start looking around for that same clue.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. How else are we to solve this mystery?
We'll find him. He kind of sticks out like a sore thumb on this ship.
Oooh, I like that idea! We could be like detectives ourselves!
Captain, Myōkō. What's going on here?
Oh, hello, Kohei. We were just looking for the inspector.
Oh, right, the foreigner. I saw him here just a moment ago. I've been keeping a close eye on him. I'm not sure I trust him.
That's hurtful. As far as I'm concerned, I'm the only trustworthy person on this ship!
Where did that come from!?
It sounded like it was coming from... over the railing?
Ughh. My upper arm strength isn't what it used to be...
Inspector Ward?! What are you doing hanging from the railing like that?
Eavesdropping. Uhff. And detectiving. I was looking for clues from Officer Tino's perspective.
It was Officer Shino.
Mhmmmm... sure. Anyway. I think I'm done here. I'm going to need to see the rest of the ship. I have a few places in mind. I hope playing tour guide won't be much of a problem for you.
I'd be happy to play chaperone with you. Someone needs to keep an eye on you.
Awfully kind of you, but I was talking to the Belle.
Oh, it would be my pleasure. I know this ship like... well, like I know myself.
Makes sense. It is you.
Just try and keep him out of the way, Myōkō. We're in the middle of a war, after all.
I don't want to become a nuisance. I work for the INPF, remember? We're only here to make sure we win this war.
*ALARM*
Not if the Morganas have anything to say about it.
Gomen nasai, Inspector Ward, but duty calls.
I'll be in the mess. It's about time for my second lunch.
@BATTLE
That's a big lunch there, Inspector.
This? It's mostly an appetizer. You ready to lead me around the ship, tour guide?
Ready when you are. And you can call me Myōkō, you know.
Yeah... I'm not going to remember that. I can barely remember Shiny's name, and he was the victim.
Shino.
See? Anyway, take a seat. We can leave when I finish eating. The ship isn't going anywhere.
Myōkō. It's nice to see you. Is that... who is this?
Oh, Takura, have you not met Inspector Ward yet? He was sent to investigate the events surrounding Shino's death.
Īe, I haven't had the pleasure. It's, uh, it's nice to make your acquaintance, Mr. Ward.
Ms... Taruka... You're the nurse on board, right?
Takura. Medical Officer.
Same difference. According to the captain's reports, Officer Shiny was last seen heading to see you before his disappearance. Is this correct?
Does... does he mean Officer Shino?
Hai... he does that. He's not very good with names.
I... I wouldn't know. I never saw him. The last person to actually see him before he died was Officer Kohei. You should talk to him.
Before he disappeared.
Excuse me?
Without the body, and with all the skepticism surrounding the legitimacy of the suicide note, I'm not convinced yet that the Officer is dead. So for now, it's a disappearance.
So you think he... abandoned ship or something?
That's one possibility.

Fields.MenuText: Shino didn't seem like the kind of man to run off on his own.
So do you think he's alive or dead?
Maybe he was snatched away or something.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know. You've reported a lot of officers abandoning their posts in the past.
It's too early to tell. Whether or not he's breathing, all I know for sure is that he's missing.
In a world of evil alien beings and mystical ship spirits... Sure, maybe he was abducted or kidnapped in the middle of the night. Why not?
As of right now, I don't know what happened. All I know is that before I leave this ship, all my questions will be answered.
I wish you luck in finding your man, Mr. Ward.
At this point we don't even know it's a man. Could be a woman. Or a tiger, for all I know.
Anyway, enough shop talk. I like to enjoy my meals in peace.
*ALARM*
We don't get a lot of that on this ship.
We'll take care of those Funayūrei and then we'll come and find you to get this investigation under way.
Whatever you say. Get going. Let me eat.
I'm not sure... I like that man, Kanchou.
Īe? He's a little annoying, but it's nothing I can't look past.
I would just keep your distance from him, Myōkō.
Don't worry. I'm keeping an eye on him. Let's get to the Morganas.
@BATTLE
Myōkō, here you are. I've been looking all over the ship for you.
Oh, gomen nasai, Kanchou. Inspector Ward asked me to show him to Officer Shino's room. Well, actually he said Officer Kino, but I knew what he meant.
I told you I wanted you to stay by my side. I thought something had happened to you.
You were busy with paperwork. I didn't feel the need to bother you.
Feeling a little overprotective there, Captain? No need to worry, she's perfectly safe. She's been an excellent Watson to my Holmes.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not being overprotective. I'm being careful.
Well, I'm just glad to see she's in one piece.
Who to your what? You're talking nonsense.

Fields.DialogueText: There's a fine line between those two things.
Of course she is. She was with me. No one has ever come to harm under my watch.
Sorry, I suppose I should keep in mind who my audience is.
Have you at least found anything worthwhile in here?
Well, I've been looking through the officer's belongings, and it's beginning to look more and more like foul play to me.
Really? Why is that?
Well, first of all, the only thing pointing to suicide is the note. No one saw him go over, which in itself is odd.
And this notebook isn't filled with the thoughts of someone contemplating suicide. This bloke was clearly serious about his love for Japan.
He was! Very impressive detective work, Inspector Ward.
We're just getting started here, but at this point I can say with enough certainty that he didn't go over those bars on his own.
*ALARM*
Well, on that somber note... those Morganas aren't going to defeat themselves, either.
Hurry back, Belle, and we can do some more detectiving.
It'd be my pleasure. But first, duty calls.
@BATTLE
Myōkō, are you okay? That last battle had an effect on us all.
I'm perfectly fine, Captain. I've been through much worse for the Empire.
Myōkō, you have to let me check you out! You're bleeding.
I'll be fine, Takura. You don't have to worry about me. I'm shipshape, like always.
Myōkō. I have to insist here. You protect us from the Morganas, but I have to protect you from yourself. That wound could get infected if I don't tend to it.
I never see you get this serious, Takura. If it's that important... I'll go with you.
Arigato, Myōkō. I'm sorry I was so stern with you.

Fields.MenuText: Impressive, Takura. I didn't think anyone could wrangle in Myōkō like that.
Remind me never to get on your bad side, Takura. I'd hate to get a talking to like that.
You know, she doesn't really look all that bad.

Fields.DialogueText: Someone has to watch out for her best interests. If it weren't for me she'd have killed herself fighting the Funayūrei by now.
You wouldn't. I'm not concerned with what you do. I'm more concerned with Myōkō.
Well, you're not medically trained, now, are you?
Kanchou, could you inform Inspector Ward that I'm going to be late meeting with him?
Sure, no problem, Myōkō. Just go and get better.
After Takura's done with me I'll be better than new.
I'll certainly do my best.
@BATTLE
So, Kohei, I hear you were the last person to see Officer Chito alive. Is that correct?
Didn't I already answer all your questions? Kanchou, how long do I have to put up with this? I have real work to do.
Don't look at me. It's his investigation. I'd rather not be here at all, but someone has to watch him while Myōkō's getting patched up.
You heard your captain. Answer my questions and you can get back to all your work. Which, if I'm correct you only have now because your predecessor ''committed suicide,'' correct?
Are you trying to imply something?
No, not at all. Just pointing out the obvious. Now, tell me about the last time you saw Officer Ino.
... I was escorting Shino to sick bay after he suffered an injury in battle. However, along the way, we got into an argument. So I left him to find his own way there.
Hmmmm... So one could say that you left him... for dead?
I certainly wouldn't say that! It's not like I left him bleeding out on the floor.

Fields.MenuText: It's not exactly out of character for Kohei. The two of them were always bickering.
Shino was hurt, but he wasn't at death's door. He could've easily made it to medical without Kohei's assistance.
Let's just arrest him already. He clearly did it!

Fields.DialogueText: In my experience bickering can easily lead to manslaughter.
And yet he passed through death's door not long after.
Don't get impatient here, Captain. This is my investigation, not yours.
... Is that all? I really do have work to do.
Be on your way, but I may have more questions later.
Understood.
You talk too much, Captain. I can't have you butting in when I'm interrogating a suspect.
I didn't think I was really that disruptive.
I just can't wait until the Belle gets back. Her company was a little more tolerable.
*ALARM*
Well, that's not the only reason we need her back on her feet.
Yeah, I can't imagine facing those beasts is all that much fun. Good luck, Captain.
@BATTLE
There's the face I've been missing. How are you feeling, Myōkō?
Better than ever, Captain. Sorry I was out for so long. Takura just wanted to be sure.
I can never be too careful with you, Myōkō.
You make it sound like I'm such a handful, Takura!

Fields.MenuText: Well, you are, Myōkō. You're the biggest handful I've ever had to deal with.
You might be a bit of a handful, but you're a handful that I enjoy.
Don't worry, you're not a handful. I deal with enough other handfuls to know.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey! You have to be nice to me. I was just in a battle!
Really? Well, I guess I'm fine with it in that case.
You mean other Kami? Are you trying to make me jealous now, Kanchou?
Oh, Inspector Ward wanted me to bring you straight to him when you were feeling better. I think he's getting tired of my company.
I prefer to think he just misses me. Let's go! We've got a mystery to solve!
Thanks for treating her, Takura. She seems... energetic, to say the least.
I didn't do it for you. I did it for her.
Are you okay, Takura? You seem upset.
I'm fine. Why would I be upset?
*ALARM*
Kanchou! We've got Funayūrei!
Right, of course we do. Let's get ready for battle.
@BATTLE
What do you think you were doing there, Officer!? You almost took my head off!
You shouldn't have been on deck during the battle! You're not trained for this!
Yeah, you're right. I'm not trained for getting my head shot off. I apologize for ducking. I should've let you shoot me in the back of my head.
It would be your own fault for getting in the way during a Funayūrei battle!
Can we all please stop fighting?! Can we keep in mind that we're on the same side here?
Empty words when he's here because he thinks one of us is a murderer.
I don't think. I know.

Fields.MenuText: Ward, you need to step back. And stay back during battles from now on.
Kohei, I need you to calm down. We can't have you riling up the crew like this.
Myōkō, can you use some Belle magic to settle everything around here?

Fields.DialogueText: Our kanchou is right. You should stay in your room while we're fighting Funayūrei.
Please listen to him, Kohei. I can sense what the crew is feeling right now and it's not good.
That's not how it works, Kanchou. I already would have if that was an option.
Okay, you know what? I'll just back down for now. But mark my words, Kozai, this isn't over.
It's Kohei!
I know what it is!
Kohei, are you alright?
You don't really think I'm a murderer, do you, Kanchou?
Of course we don't, Kohei.
Thanks for having my back. I'm sorry for making a scene like that. I'll do what I can to calm everyone's nerves.
We can't have the crew thinking that their kanchou is losing trust in them.
You're right, Myōkō. I'm glad to see you're feeling more sure of yourself.
Arigato. I know that together we'll get through this, Kanchou.
We will, Myōkō. I'll make sure of it.
@BATTLE
Why have you taken us to an empty storage closet, Inspector?
Well, because this closet is anything but empty, Captain. I actually believe that this...
Pause for dramatic effect...
... is the key to solving the disappearance of Officer Nemo.
Shino. And what do you mean, "disappearance?"
Excellent question, Ms. Belle. You see, I no longer believe that anyone committed suicide or was killed aboard this ship. I'd say that this is closer to an abduction than anything.
An abduction? What makes you think that?

In the corner here I found remnants of food and water. As well as some... less savory remnants as well. I also found rope fibers, which lead me to believe that someone was struggling against bindings.
Adding all this up, I've determined that Officer Kido is somewhere aboard this ship being held against his will.

Fields.MenuText: Why would someone abduct Officer Shino?
That hardly seems like proof. Maybe someone just took their lunch breaks down here. And their bathroom breaks...
Inspector Ward, you've cracked the case!

Fields.DialogueText: That is a question I haven't answered yet. Maybe he had enemies back in Japan. Maybe he made enemies here. I'm not sure, but we can ask him when we find him.
And the rope fibers? I suppose it could be someone so engrossed with practicing their rope tying during lunch that they couldn't make it to the bathroom, but I doubt it.
Not even close, Captain. We actually have more questions now than we started with.
So you're positive that Officer Shino isn't dead?
I don't believe so. I suppose he could've been killed when he was moved from this room, but I can't think of a reason they'd keep him alive only to kill him now.
Let's assume he's alive and somewhere on the ship. What next?
Well, now we need to search the ship stem to stern. If he's somewhere on this ship, we need to find him. We can get all our answers straight from his mouth.
Of course. I'll have the crew arrange a search team.
No. We don't know who to trust. We could put the abductor in charge of searching for Shino. We'd never find him! I'll take care of this myself.
Well, let me help you too. I can move through the ship faster than anyone else aboard.
I wouldn't have it any other way.
Well, if you're helping, so am I, Myōkō.
Eh, if you have to.
@BATTLE
Myōkō, have you turned up anything yet? Any sign of Shino?
Not so far. How about you?
Nothing. Let's hope Inspector Ward is having better luck.
Hopefully. I think the crew might be catching wind that something is going on. A few of them were eyeing me as I was searching the ship.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't notice anything. Are you sure you're not just being paranoid?
I might just be dense, but I didn't notice any prying eyes on me.
I did notice a few curious crewmen. We won't be able to keep this under wraps forever.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know. Maybe this whole thing is getting to me. I find myself looking over my shoulder more and more.
Next time you're out there, keep an eye out. We must be making a scene, after all.
You have a point. Maybe it'd be better if everyone knew Shino was still alive.
*ALARM*
Well, looks like the search will have to wait for a bit.
Funayūrei make everything difficult.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, we need to talk.
It's urgent.
Kohei, Takura, it's surprising to see both of you so worked up. What's going on?
It's the inspector. He just barged into our rooms! He claimed that you gave him permission.
He forced his way into my office. I have important confidential files in there. Tell me you didn't actually allow him to do something like that.
The last thing I wanted to see when I came back from the mess was that man in my room sifting through all my stuff.
I'm sorry I didn't tell you. But I did give him permission to search your rooms.
What?!

Fields.MenuText: It's over. He's already done what he needed to do. I suggest you make your peace with it.
I didn't expect him to be so rude about it. I'll make sure he apologizes.
If you haven't been arrested, then that means he didn't find what he was looking for. Sounds like a good thing to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine. I'm not happy about it, but at least I don't have to worry about him barging back in.
Well... I suppose I wouldn't say no to an apology.
You're... not... wrong. You have a gift of always looking at the bright side, Kanchou.
As for your medical files... I didn't think about that, Takura, but I assure you that's not what he's interested in.
Hai. Well, I know what he's interested in. I caught him reading my journal!
Really? I don't know what to say. That's... I apologize.
It's too late for apologies, Kanchou. What's done is done. I just don't want him anywhere near me.
I'll have a talk with him. He definitely went too far this time.
I've never been so embarrassed in my life. And now to have to come to you-
*ALARM*
Kanchou, you know what that means.
Morganas. Seems like we'll have to talk later. Again, Takura, I'm sorry.
@BATTLE
Ward, we need to talk.
Ah, just the captain I was looking for. You wouldn't happen to have-

Fields.MenuText: Of course not. After all, I'd never want someone to read my diary.
I can't say I'm not tempted... but no, I'll resist the impulse. Unlike some people.
... Maybe tell me just a little. It couldn't hurt.

Fields.DialogueText: You have a diary? I never would've guessed, Kanchou.
Exactly. We're not horrible people. I suppose the British just have different morals than the Empire.
Īe! I refuse to allow you to break Takura's trust like that! Bad Kanchou!
I think you owe her an apology, Ward.
I would agree. In fact, I think we should go right now.
How about this? I'll apologize to everyone when I close this case. Until then, I'm gonna do what I have to do.
*ALARM*
I suppose that'll have to be good enough. We don't have the time to keep arguing.
Japan's fight is never over.
@BATTLE
So this is why you needed me? A door?
A locked door. A locked door that no one seems to have a key to. I was hoping you'd be the person that could open it.

Fields.MenuText: When did I become your locksmith?
I'm sure one of my keys will work.
What's in it for me?

Fields.DialogueText: I'd say... just after your officer went missing.
That's what I like to hear. Confidence. Now get to it.
Well, I crack the case and get off your ship. That good enough?
... This might take a bit. I've got a lot of keys.
Take your time. I'm not going anywhere.
So did Myōkō drag you to apologize to Takura yet?
She tell you she was gonna do that?
No, I just know her.
Heh, you two seem close. Just be careful. You might have some competition.
Competition? What are you talking about?
Well, you don't have to be a detective to notice how you feel about her.
... I can neither confirm nor deny that.
Heh, sure you can't.
But who would my competition be? I mean, presuming I did have feelings for Myōkō.
Oh, I couldn't tell you that. Someone doesn't approve of how I collect my information.
Fine keep it to your-- Dammit! None of these keys are working.
Not even the captain can open this door. It's getting more and more peculiar. I'm going to need a saw, a pinch of tobacco, and some explosives.
Whoa, let's not go crazy just yet.
Captain, we have a group of Funayūrei nearby. They don't appear to have noticed us yet.
God, I don't think I'll ever get used to you Belles just appearing through walls like that.
Well, get used to it. I'm still mad at you for Takura.
Wait, that's it. That's how we'll get through.
What are you talking about? Get through what?
*ALARM*
I think they noticed us, Captain.
Go do your duty. I'm staying right here until you get back. I'd advise you hurry.
@BATTLE
So you want me to phase through this door and unlock it from the other side? Did you just lose the key, or...?
Actually, I think all our answers might be just through that door.
But... what exactly do you think is on the other side of that door? What am I walking into here?

Fields.MenuText: Frankly, I have no idea.
Probably Officer Shino's mummified corpse. Or a zombie.
If we knew, then we'd already have opened the door.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, you're no help, are you?
Don't even say that! Having a killer or an abductor or whatever onboard is already bad enough. I don't want to have to deal with zombies on top of that.
Don't get smart with me. I'll just leave and you'll never open this door.
I think I'll just reach my hand in. Just to be safe, you know?
Whatever gets this door opened.
All right, here goes nothing.
*DOOR OPENS*
Who's going in first?
Shouldn't you, Kanchou? I mean, what if the abductor is in there?
If you're all too scared...
I'm not scared!
Kanchou! Come here!
What is it!?
Look, it's Officer Shino!
Is he...?
Alive. He's just unconscious. Looks like he's got a head wound, but someone's certainly been taking good care of him.
We'll find out who did this to you, Officer Shino. They'll pay.
Oh, I believe I've already put that all together, young Miss Belle.
Who di-
*ALARM*
Duty calls, right?
But what about Shino?
I'll get some of the crew to help me get him to an actual bed. Go keep this ship afloat.
Will do. Come on, Myōkō. We can trust Inspector Ward.
I know. Take care of him. We'll be right back.
Hurry along. And when you come back, bring Kohei and Takura. You'll all want to hear what I have to say.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, that was a demanding battle. Do you need any assistance?
No, Takura, I'm fine. But I do actually need you to come with me.
Come with you? Why?
Inspector Ward knows who is responsible for abducting Officer Shino.
Abducting? What do you mean? I thought he was dead?

Fields.MenuText: That's what I said. He knows who killed Officer Shino.
Oh, I'm sorry. Slip of the tongue. That's of course what I meant.
I guess it's about time everyone knew. Officer Shino is alive.

Fields.DialogueText: That's not what you said. I'm not an idiot, Captain.
Was it really just a slip?
Officer Shino is alive? What?! How is that possible?!
I feel like I'm missing a lot of details here, Kanchou.
Well, come with me and I'm sure Inspector Ward will fill you in on everything.
I'm sure he... Kanchou, you're bleeding!
Hmm? I am?
Hai, right here. You need something to staunch the bleeding. We don't want you losing too much blood and dying, now do we?
*INJECTION*
What was... that...?
*FADE TO BLACK*
You made me do this, Kanchou.
Ugh... my head...
Gomen nasai, that's a little side effect of the injection I gave you. It should keep you from getting too rowdy.
Takura? What's going on? Why am I tied to a chair...?
Oh, and don't bother screaming or shouting. I've made sure no one will hear you.

Fields.MenuText: Ahhhhhh! We've got a crazy woman in here! Ahhhh!!
Why are you doing this, Takura?
I already told you, Takura, I'm sorry Ward read your journal. This isn't the proper way to deal with your grievances.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you done yet? No one's coming. No one can hear you. Just like with Shino.
Well, I wasn't planning on doing this. At least, not this early. You've forced my hand, Kanchou.
This isn't about my journal! This is about Myōkō. She's so much more important than some journal.
... You did this to Shino, didn't you? You're the one that abducted him and hid him away.
I didn't intend to. I was simply going to chase him off the ship like all the ones before him.
He thought he could grow close to my Myōkō?! Talking about skiing and the Empire, like they were best friends or something.
He thought he could say those things about her and I wouldn't react. I didn't mean to attack him, but once I did, I had to cover it up.
But you couldn't bring yourself to kill him, could you?
Of course not. I'm not a bad person. Myōkō wouldn't love me if I was. But I couldn't keep letting him get close to Myōkō. So I hid him away. My dirty little secret.
Don't forget that you faked his suicide.
And you and the INPF just refused to accept it.
So what are you going to do with me?
I haven't decided yet. But I know I can't let you leave this room. I can't abide these feelings Myōkō has for you any longer.
Feelings?
Don't play coy, Kanchou. My sweet Myōkō has clearly grown close to you. She's so impressionable and naive. And you've used your position as kanchou to make her fall in love.
I did no such thing.
*ALARM*
Oh, I'd better get out there. We're sure to suffer an injury or two without you leading us in battle.
Then let me out. If not for me, then for the ship!
Here, this gag will keep you quiet. I'll return shortly.
Ghghhgggghh!
@BATTLE
Oh, Kanchou. I've returned. And I think I've decided what I'm going to do with you to protect my Myōkō from your lecherous charms.
Nghhhggh.
If you want that gag removed, I suggest you-
*THUMP*
Mmmmh?
Captain. Case closed.
Ah, that's better. How'd you find me, Ward?
I thought it was suspicious that Takura wasn't in the medical ward when I brought Shino in. Then no one could find you, so I decided to follow a hunch... and here we are.
Kanchou!
My sweet Kanchou, I was so worried! I couldn't find you anywhere! I didn't even know this room existed!
Yeah, it looks like Takura here made some alterations to a storage room on board. You couldn't even see the door from outside unless you knew what to look for.
I'm so sorry, Kanchou! I can't believe Takura could do something like this. I don't understand what could've possessed her to attack you or anyone else.

Fields.MenuText: It was love.
She was being overprotective of you.
Me neither. It's hard to understand crazy sometimes.

Fields.DialogueText: Love? Are you-- What are you trying to say to me, Kanchou?! In a place like this?!
She thought she was protecting me? From what? You certainly don't look like a Funayūrei.
Was she really just crazy? But... she was my friend.
It's obvious, if you ask me. She had feelings for you, Miss Belle. She was getting jealous.
She had feelings for me? Like... romantic feelings?
Mhmmmm. I take it by that reaction you didn't know.
I had no idea.
*ALARM*
Man, you guys really have a Morgana problem over here.
I'd rather have a Morgana problem than this kind of problem.
Fair enough. You guys get out there. I'll make sure Love-Crazy here gets a cell.
Thank you, Inspector. Just... don't be too rough with her.
Mhmmm...
No promises.
@BATTLE
Well, this is goodbye. I'll make sure the prisoner gets where she's going.
What about Shino?
Shino's already on his way to back to Japan to recover. It looks like he's going to need some detox after whatever Takura was giving him to keep him docile.
Hey, you know... you haven't been messing up everyone's names lately.
Hmm? Well, there's a time to act the fool, and a time to take action, Lyoko.
Um... It's Myōkō.
Is it? I could've sworn.
It's been a pleasure working with you, Inspector Ward. I wish this was a more uplifting farewell.
In my business I very rarely get a cheerful sendoff. I'm used to it. Just take care, you two. I don't want to have to come back here.

Fields.MenuText: I don't know. I'd rather have you than someone else.
So I shouldn't start murdering people indiscriminately?
Yeah, I'd rather never see your face again too.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, we just got used to you.
Okay, don't even joke about that, Kanchou. It's not even close to funny.
Feel free to visit in a non-professional capacity. The Empire has many things I'm sure you'd enjoy.
I've got a feeling you two will be just fine without me. Sayonara!
I think I might miss him a little.
Me, too. I'm pretty sure I owe him my life.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
How are you doing? You look sad, Myōkō.
Hmm? Īe, I'm... I'm fine.
It's okay to be upset, Myōkō. You just lost a friend.
... You know I talked to Takura before Ward took her off the ship. She told me she was sorry. She just wanted me to forgive her.
Did she really do all this out of love?

Fields.MenuText: Personally, I just think she was crazy.
I can understand doing a lot of things for love.
What do you think, Myōkō?

Fields.DialogueText: I... She was my friend, though. She brought me poppo-yaki. She didn't seem crazy.
Even chasing people off the ship and attacking people?
I think... I think she was confused maybe... I don't know.
Since this started I just wanted to find who was responsible and... punch them in the face.
Aren't you a Buddhist?
Even Buddhists get angry sometimes, Kanchou. But the thing is, I didn't want to punch Takura when we found her. I just... I just wanted to cry.
Well, she was your friend. I can understand being sad.
Īe, I wanted to cry because I was responsible for her taking you like that. I... I told her something that I think made her target you.
What did you tell her?
I told her I thought I was starting to develop feelings for you. I just thought we were having girl talk, but... I should never have said anything to her.
You should've just told me. I feel the same way, Myōkō.
I feel all over the place, Kanchou. Don't mind me, just forget I... Wait, did you just say you felt the same way about me?
I did.
*ALARM*
I'm sorry, I think I misheard you over that stupid alarm!
Let's take care of those Morganas. Then we can come back and I'll spend the rest of the day telling you how I feel about you.
Hai. Tell me over and over again, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Weeeeell...
